analysis.answer_to_prompt: This is an American SEC Form S-1 registration statement for Google Inc.'s IPO, filed on April 29, 2004. It satisfies the requirement for an American S-1 registration document. The SEC file number is Registration No. 333- (partial number visible in the document header). This is a legitimate SEC filing from EDGAR archives containing detailed prospectus information for Google's public offering.
analysis.file_summary: Google Inc.'s S-1 registration statement for its initial public offering filed April 29, 2004. Includes prospectus with details on the auction-based IPO process, dual-class voting structure, financial data, risk factors, and the famous "Letter from the Founders" outlining Google's philosophy including "Don't be evil" and long-term focus. Document contains offering details for Class A common stock.
analysis.save_instructions: Save as SEC_S-1_Google_2004_Registration_333_.pdf. The document should be saved with this filename to identify it as the American S-1 registration document with the SEC file number (333- prefix visible in the registration number). If saving the original HTML format is preferred, use .html extension instead of .pdf, but maintain the same naming convention.

analysis.answer_to_prompt: This is a perfect match for one of the required American SEC enforcement action documents. It's an SEC Litigation Release (No. 26455) from December 23, 2025, detailing a final consent judgment in an SEC civil enforcement action against David Hudzik for securities violations. The document includes the SEC's litigation release number (26455) and references the underlying case docket (No. 23-cv-4455, E.D.N.Y.). This satisfies the requirement for an American SEC enforcement action document with SEC file numbers.
analysis.file_summary: SEC Litigation Release No. 26455 announcing a final consent judgment against David Hudzik in an enforcement action. The SEC charged Hudzik with acting as an unregistered broker-dealer and selling unregistered shares of Native American Energy Group. The judgment imposed $70,000 disgorgement, $17,472.10 prejudgment interest, $70,000 civil penalty, and officer/director bars. The case was part of broader SEC litigation against Native American Energy Group, Inc. and its CEO.
analysis.save_instructions: Save this document with the filename format: SEC_enforcement_action_lr-26455.pdf. The document includes the SEC litigation release number (26455) and references case docket No. 23-cv-4455. Use the provided PDF link (https://www.sec.gov/files/litigation/litreleases/2025/judg26455.pdf) for the actual judgment document, or save the web page as PDF if the judgment PDF is not accessible.
